title: Snowboarding - Austria's Gasser wins first Olympic big air gold
text: February 22, 2018 / 1:58 AM / Updated 43 minutes ago Snowboarding: Austria's Gasser wins first Olympic big air gold Reuters Staff 1 Min Read PYEONGCHANG,   Austrian Anna Gasser won the first Olympic snowboarding big air gold medal on Thursday with a combined score of 185.00 from her two best runs in the Pyeongchang Winter Games final. Gasser, who finished 15th in the slopestyle event last week, put down a 96.00 with the final run of the day to snatch gold from Jamie Anderson of the United States. Slideshow (6 Images) The American took silver with 177.25 and New Zealand’s Zoi Sadowski-Synnott the bronze with a combined 157.50. It was New Zealand’s second medal in Winter Olympics history. The women’s final was brought forward to Thursday as high winds are forecast for Friday. The big air competition is making its Olympic debut at the Pyeongchang Winter Games. The men’s final is scheduled for Saturday. Reporting by Peter Rutherford; Editing by Greg Stutchbury
